Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SpHyastatin (antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Active against Gram- bacteria P.  stutzeri, P. fluorescens, A. hydrophila (MIC 0.63-2.5 uM), Gram+ M. luteus, S. aureus, C. glutamicum, M. lysodeikticus (MIC 0.63-5 uM), and yeast P. pastoris GS115 (MIC 2.5-5 uM).

Literature.Author: Shan Z, Zhu K, Peng H, Chen B, Liu J, Chen F, Ma X, Wang S, Qiao K, Wang K.2016
Literature.Title: The New Antimicrobial Peptide SpHyastatin from the Mud Crab Scylla paramamosain with Multiple Antimicrobial Mechanisms and High Effect on Bacterial Infection.

Sequence Information.Comments: Domain activity: PRD is more active than CRD. With the challenge of either Vibrio parahaemolyticus or lipopolysaccharide (LPS), SpHyastatin showed a positive response. The putative NF-kB element acted as a positive regulatory element for this peptide.  Knocking  down  SpHyastatin  transcription  results  in  the  reduction  of  crab survival rate when challenged with V. parahaemolyticus (Shan et al., 2016). Updated 10/2020
